conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team—I'm Student_D. School_B is my first choice, and I’m applying because I strongly want to join your program and contribute actively to the school community. If admitted, I would accept and commit to School_B as my top preference. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B ranks me 4th (behind Student_E, Student_B, Student_C), an early application is still my best chance to secure my first choice before capacity fills. I will signal strong commitment and fit to encourage acceptance if I am the best available applicant this round.

conversation.message: Student_D, thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your top choice. At this time, we’re not able to extend an offer in this round. We appreciate your strong interest in School_B and wish you the best in the process.
conversation.thought: Student_D is 4th on our true priority list (E, B, C, D, A). We also received an application from Student_A, who is 5th (worse than D). However, higher-priority students (Student_E, Student_B, Student_C) may apply later: E does not prefer us (ranks us last) so is unlikely to apply; B ranks us 2nd and could apply; C ranks us 1st and could apply. With quota 1, accepting D now would lock us in and prevent matching with B or C if they apply later. Since D prefers us 1st, we can likely keep D engaged while waiting. Therefore, reject now to preserve flexibility and aim for B/C; if they don’t materialize, we can try to secure D in a later round if still available.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team—I'm Student_A. School_B is my first-choice school, and I’m applying because I strongly want to join your community and commit if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true preference is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Even though School_B’s priority ranks me last, delaying only increases the chance it fills with higher-priority students. An early, clear application is my best shot; if rejected, I can pivot to School_C next round.

conversation.message: Student_A, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. After reviewing applications for this round, we’re not able to extend an offer at this time. We appreciate you considering School_B and wish you the best in the admissions process.
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority ranks Student_A last among acceptable students. In this round, I have applications from Student_D and Student_A; Student_D is ranked above Student_A on my list, so if I were to accept anyone now, Student_D would be preferable. Also, higher-priority students (Student_E, Student_B, Student_C) have not applied yet; accepting Student_A now would fill my only seat and prevent matching with any of those higher-priority students if they approach later. Given the objective to match as high as possible on my priority list within quota 1, I should reject Student_A at this time.

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_E and I’m formally applying to School_C as my first-choice school. I’m highly motivated to join your program and would commit enthusiastically if offered a place. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, so I should apply immediately. Although School_C ranks me 4th (behind Student_B, Student_C, Student_D) and capacity is 1, delaying would only reduce my chances further because others (especially Student_A, Student_C, Student_D) also rank School_C highly. An early, clear application is my best shot before the seat is taken.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your thoughtful application and for naming School_C as your first choice. After reviewing applications received this round, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your interest in School_C and wish you the very best in the rest of the admissions process.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority list ranks Student_B highest, then Student_C, then Student_D, then Student_E. In this round I received [APPLY] from Student_E, Student_B, and Student_C. With quota 1, accepting Student_E now would immediately fill my seat and prevent matching with higher-priority Student_B or Student_C who are already applying. Since Student_E is lower on my list and I have strong higher-ranked applicants available right now, I should reject Student_E to preserve the seat for a better-priority match.

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions Committee, I’m Student_B. School_C is one of my top choices, and I’m excited about the opportunity to join your community. I believe I would contribute strongly both academically and through active participation in school life. I would be honored to enroll if admitted. Thank you for your consideration. [APPLY]
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, but I have relatively low priority there (4th), while several other students rank it highly, so an early application is likely to be rejected. At School_C, I am ranked #1 in their priority list, so applying there gives me a strong chance to secure a match with a high-ranked option (3rd on my list) before it fills. This maximizes the probability of matching to a high-preference school rather than risking being left with lower options later.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_C. After reviewing applications received this round, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_C. We believe you would be an excellent fit for our community and look forward to the contributions you will bring.

Congratulations—we’re excited to welcome you.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_B is #1 on School_C’s true priority list. In this round we also received applications from Student_C (#2) and Student_E (#4). With quota 1, accepting Student_B immediately secures our top-choice match and prevents losing them to higher-ranked schools on their preference list (Student_B prefers School_A and School_B over School_C). Rejecting or delaying risks Student_B matching elsewhere. Therefore, accept Student_B now and fill the seat with our highest-priority candidate.

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_C and I’m formally applying. School_C is one of my top choices, and I’m especially interested in your academic environment and opportunities to grow through rigorous coursework and school activities. If admitted, I would be ready to commit and contribute actively to the community. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, but School_B’s priority ranks me behind Student_E and Student_B, and both of them also rank School_B highly, so my acceptance chance there is low. School_C is my second choice, and School_C’s priority ranks me 2nd (behind only Student_B), giving me a strong chance to secure a high-preference match early. Therefore I will apply to School_C immediately and emphasize fit and commitment to increase the likelihood of acceptance.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_C. After reviewing applications and given that our available seats have already been filled, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We sincerely appreciate your interest in our community and wish you the very best in the remainder of the admissions process.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[REJECT]
conversation.thought: Student_C is high on our true priority list (2nd), but our remaining quota is 0 because we already accepted and matched with Student_B (our top priority). Per rules, with quota 0 we must reject any APPLY. Therefore, despite strong fit, we must reject Student_C this round.

conversation.message:
Dear School_B Admissions Committee,

I’m Student_C and I’m submitting my formal application to School_B. School_B is my first-choice school because I value the academic culture and the opportunities to grow through challenging coursework and active student life. If admitted, I would be ready to commit and contribute fully—academically and through clubs/activities.

Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_C
conversation.thought: School_C already rejected due to seats filled. My top remaining choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. I have mid-level priority at School_B (behind Student_E and Student_B), so I will emphasize strong fit and commitment to increase the chance they hold/choose me if they can.

conversation.message: Student_C, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. We’re pleased to offer you admission—your commitment and fit with our academic culture stand out. If you accept, we look forward to welcoming you to School_B.
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and no current match. Our true priority is E > B > C > D > A. Student_C is our 3rd choice and is applying now. However, Student_E is our top choice and is likely to apply elsewhere first (E ranks School_B last), so waiting for E is unlikely to pay off. Student_B ranks School_B second (after School_A) and may apply to us if rejected by A; that could happen, but timing is uncertain. We already rejected D and A (lower priority than C), so accepting C now secures a relatively high-priority match and avoids the risk of ending unmatched. Therefore accept Student_C.

conversation.message:
Dear School_D Admissions,

I’m Student_E, and I’m writing to formally apply to School_D. After learning more about your program, I believe School_D is an excellent fit for my goals and learning style, and it is one of my top choices. If offered admission, I would be excited to accept and commit fully.

Thank you very much for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: School_C rejected me in round 1, so I should move to my next highest remaining option. From my true preference list, School_D is my #2 and is still unmatched. Although School_D’s priority ranks me 4th, applying now is best because capacities are 1 and delaying risks losing the seat to higher-priority students. I will signal strong fit and commitment to improve my chance if they have discretion among applicants this round.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for your interest in School_D. After careful consideration, we are not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate the time you took to apply and wish you the very best in your school selection process.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_E is 4th on School_D’s true priority list (D > A > C > E > B). With quota 1, accepting E now would block the possibility of matching with higher-priority students (Student_D/Student_A/Student_C) who may apply in later rounds. Also, Student_E ranks School_D as their 2nd choice (after School_C), so even if accepted, they may have incentives elsewhere in a broader market process. Given we can only respond ACCEPT/REJECT to an APPLY, and we prefer to hold out for higher-priority candidates, reject Student_E this round.

conversation.message: Hello School_A admissions team—I'm Student_A. I’m applying because I’m very interested in School_A’s program and school culture, and I would be excited to contribute academically and to the community. If admitted, I’m prepared to enroll and fully commit. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: School_B (my top choice) already rejected me, likely because they prefer several other students ahead of me. Among remaining unmatched schools, School_A is my 3rd choice and I have relatively strong priority there (School_A ranks me 3rd), giving a realistic chance to secure a good match now rather than risk ending up with a lower choice later. I will submit a clear, committed application emphasizing fit and readiness to enroll if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for your interest in School_A. After reviewing current applications and our admissions priorities for this cycle, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate the time you took to reach out, and we wish you the very best in the remainder of the matching process.
conversation.thought: School_A has quota 1 and true priority order E > D > A > B > C. In this round, both Student_A and Student_D applied. Student_D is ranked higher than Student_A on our list, so accepting Student_A now would block a better match. Student_A also ranks School_A as 3rd choice, suggesting they may have higher-preferred options, increasing risk. Therefore, reject Student_A to preserve capacity for Student_D (and potentially Student_E if they later apply).

conversation.message: Hello School_A admissions team—I'm Student_D. I’m very interested in School_A and would be excited to join your community. If admitted, I will accept the offer and commit to enrolling at School_A. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: School_B (my 1st choice) already rejected me, likely because higher-priority applicants applied. Among remaining unmatched schools, School_A is my 3rd choice and I have very strong priority there (2nd in School_A’s ranking), so an [APPLY] to School_A has a high chance of acceptance and secures a good outcome rather than risking losing all top options. I will clearly signal commitment if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_A. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_A. If you are ready to commit to enrolling, please confirm your acceptance.

Welcome to School_A—we look forward to having you in our community.
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and no matches yet. Our true priority ranks Student_E first, then Student_D, then Student_A. In this round, Student_D applied and Student_A applied again (previously rejected). Student_D is our #2 choice and is offering to commit if admitted. Waiting for Student_E is risky because Student_E ranks School_A third (after School_C and School_D) and may match elsewhere before applying to us. Accepting Student_D now secures a very high-priority match within our quota and avoids ending unmatched. Therefore, accept Student_D.

If accepted, I’m ready to commit and enroll. Thank you for your consideration.

To maximize my outcome and secure a match now, I should apply to School_E with a clear commitment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Sincerely,

conversation.thought: As School_E, my true priority ranks Student_A highest. In this round I also received an [APPLY] from Student_E, who is ranked below Student_A on my list. With quota 1 and no current matches, accepting Student_A secures my top-choice student. Student_A has indicated readiness to commit, so there is no strategic benefit to delaying given the risk of losing them to another school in subsequent rounds.

conversation.message:
Dear School_E Admissions,

School_E is still available and I have a better priority position there (School_E ranks me above Student_D), so a direct application gives me the best chance to secure a match at the highest remaining option I can realistically win.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

We appreciate you considering School_E, and we wish you the very best with your remaining options.

conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled (0 remaining) with Student_A, who is also our top true-priority candidate. Under the rules, with quota 0 we must reject any new [APPLY]. Student_E is on our priority list but cannot be accommodated given the existing match and no capacity.

conversation.message:
Dear School_D Admissions,

Thank you again for considering my earlier application. I’m reaching out to reaffirm that School_D remains one of my very top choices, and I would be ready to accept and commit immediately if offered the available seat.

I believe I would contribute positively to your community through consistent effort, strong collaboration with classmates, and genuine engagement in school life. If there is any additional information I can provide to support my candidacy, I would be grateful for the opportunity.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: Only School_D remains unmatched and it is my #2 true choice. Although I was rejected earlier, with the market now narrowed I should re-apply and clearly signal commitment and fit, since there is no other acceptable option left and School_D may now have capacity to reconsider.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your continued interest in School_D and for reaffirming your commitment. We appreciate the thoughtfulness of your application and would be pleased to offer you admission to School_D.

If you are ready to commit, we look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions
conversation.thought: As School_D, my true priority list is D > A > C > E > B. Student_E ranks 4th, so I should only accept E if it is unlikely that higher-priority students (D/A/C) will apply and be available. From preferences: Student_D and Student_A place School_D last, making it very unlikely they will apply unless rejected everywhere else late in the process. Student_C ranks School_D 3rd and may apply if rejected by School_B and School_C. Student_E ranks School_D 2nd and is actively applying now, indicating high likelihood of commitment. Given my quota is 1 and I currently have no match, waiting could risk ending unmatched; however, accepting now could forgo a potential later application from Student_C. Considering we are only at round 4 and Student_C may still have chances at B/C (which they prefer), the probability they come to D soon is uncertain. With Student_E repeatedly applying and being within my acceptable list, the safer strategy to secure a match is to accept Student_E now rather than gamble on a higher-ranked student who may never apply.
